body.name: SENDEFN Men's Leather Belt Automatic Ratchet Buckle Slide Belt for Dress Casual Trim to Fit with Gift Box
features: ▶[Trim to Exact Fit]◀ Easy removable buckle allows you to cut the belt to your ideal size. For a perfect fit, please trimmed longer than your waist size. Complete your look with our comfortable fit men's belts!
▶[High Quality]◀ The men belt is made of durable cowhide leather strap and alloy buckle, extremely flexible and firm, and its anti-corrosion and anti-breaking keep a long time service for you.

▶[Classic Design]◀ This leather belt is an ideal men's accessory to wear as an everyday belt, super-comfortable to wear, and goes great with uniform, jeans, or formal wear. Makes your boyfriend, father, friends glamorous on any occasion.

▶[Best Gift]◀ Automatic belt is packed in an exquisite gift box, It is the utmost suitable gift for men on Anniversaries, Valentine's Day, Father's Day, Labors Day, Thanksgiving, Christmas, and other special occasions.
▶[After Sales Service]◀ Customer-first is always our principle. If there is any issue regarding our leather belt, a satisfactory solution to your issue is always available.

Automatic Ratchet Buckle Belt The men belt is made of a durable cowhide leather strap and alloy buckle, extremely flexible and firm, and its anti-corrosion and anti-breaking keep a long time service for you.
Match Different Styles Previous page Next page The leather belts are available in many styles, classic and fashionable, for all ages.

Trim the length of the belt 1. Lift The Clasp -- Finding a thin screwdriver or nipper, opening the grooved door at the back of the buckle. 2. Open The Back Belt Clamp -- Taking the strap out from the buckle. 3. Cut The Blet -- Cut the belt to your desired size and be careful how much you cut off. 4. Close The Clasp -- Reinsert back the sizing strap into the buckle and close the groove.

How quickly can I adjust my belt When I sat down? All you need to do is gently push the lever on the side and the lock will snap into place, which keeps you comfortable at all times. For a 42” waist which is better the 28-46 or the 34-50? We recommend that you can buy a larger size, and as our waistbands can be trimmed, you can always cut off more. How long is the tail of the belt? I don't like having a long tail when I put on my belt. SENDEFN's ratchet segment starts much closer to the end of belt. （It has 3.9 in) What is inside the package? Package: 1*gift box, 1*metal buckle, 1*genuine leather belt.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent belt, better than the "name brand" Dickies one that I had before!
reviews.reviewText: I previously used fabric adjustable belts, several were from Nike that had a nice buckle with good fabric and colors that were my favorite. I then got gifted a Dickies ratchet belt, similar to this one, and I rarely went back to the fabric ones as these look and function much better. The Dickies belt did wear out sooner than expected, and it also had a design flaw in that one of the pins that holds the buckle assembly together could loosen and fall out.Nevertheless, I was happy enough with it to go online and search for another one when I found these. These looked better, with lots of variations and were much cheaper as well so I ordered this one as a test. Now that I've had a chance to try it for a few weeks, I'll have no further hesitation in ordering more! The buckle is very nice and seems sturdier than the Dickies one. I haven't been able to find a similar flaw in it either, though time will tell as it took a long time before the other one broke. The ratchet release is in the opposite direction but as far as I can tell, that doesn't make any difference in function or quality.The quality of the belt seems comparable, if not better. If it shows wear too early I'll come back and update this, but so far it is holding up well. I'm definitely going to order a few more buckle/belt variations and I would recommend these to anyone buying a belt. If you haven't had one of these adjustable belts before, they are a total game-changer. No more having to go to the closest hole for the belt buckle even if it's slightly too loose/tight. Adjusting the belt in public is barely even noticeable to others, so no more embarrassing post-lunch maneuverings as you unbuckle, adjust, and buckle again, or for when you're at a concert or walking in the heat and need to tighten. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Some thought of everything!
reviews.reviewText: The major thing I already love about this belt is that it is customizable, not just adjustable but you can actually fit it to your size. I also love the clean lines and design. Buckle is modern and sophisticated. I simply feel that who ever designed this product, put thought behind it. Do I believe it’s real leather? No, do I care? No. It looks great regardless. Not to mention it’s affordable enough to order it again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Belt Buckle
reviews.reviewText: This buckle is comfortable and its ratcheting design is awesome. I can select the perfect snug fit unlike those belt buckles with hole slots. Distance between ratchet makes perfect fit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Stylish and Durable, but a Little Hard to Unfasten
reviews.reviewText: There is a lot to like about this belt. It's durable, the belt has a smooth, supple feel to it (although, like most leather products, it's actually a bit stiff out of the box) and the buckle is very stylish. Like all new leather products, it has some new leather odor to it, but I found this fairly faint, and it will probably fade away over time.The belt comes in a box that's fancy enough to pass for a gift box, which is nice to know if you want to give this belt as a gift. The belt and buckle are packed separately in the box, so you'll need to put them together. This is simple enough to do, and no tools are required. Just release the clawed clamp on the left side of the buckle under the retaining band, slip the flat end of the belt into the clamp and close the clamp all the way.My belt was actually about six inches longer than the advertised 38 inches, so the ratchet track engaged too late and didn't let me tighten the belt enough when I first put it together. But that's no problem. Just grab a good pair of scissors, cut off the unnecessary inches from the end of the belt that attaches to the buckle (NOT the tapered end!), reattach the buckle and check the fit again. If you aren't good at measuring or estimating, then do this a little bit at a time until you achieve a good fit.Fastening the belt takes a little getting used to. The retaining band is part of an articulated metal piece attached to the buckle (the retaining band is on top, and the aforementioned clamp is on the bottom), and there isn't much room between that and where the end of the belt emerges as you feed it through the buckle. This makes it quite difficult to fully fasten the belt and then feed the extra belt length through the retaining band. So, instead, you'll want to carefully feed the end of the belt through the buckle so it passes immediately through the retaining band as well, then tighten the belt and feed the excess through the nearest belt loop on your pants.The one bugaboo this belt has is with taking it off. The release lever for the ratchet is small lever that's less than 1/4" wide and no more than 1/2" long. The way I wear my belt, starting at the first belt loop left of center and passing it through the loops around my back and coming back to center from my right, that lever ends up under the lower right corner of the belt buckle. I find it awkward to reach and operate, and men with larger hands may find it even more difficult. Its small size also means it doesn't offer much leverage, so it tends to be hard to turn once you've figured out which direction to turn it. What works best for me is to grasp the buckle with my right thumb and forefinger, twist the bottom of the buckle outward, then wedge my left thumbnail against the pivot (about half an inch towards center from the right edge of the buckle) and use my left forefinger to push the free end of the lever (even with the right edge of the buckle) outward to release the ratchet pawl. I sometimes also have to push the belt a bit further into the buckle from the right in order to relieve some tension on the pawl in order to move the release lever. I subtracted a star from this otherwise excellent belt for having such a fiddly release mechanism. Hopefully, I will find it easier to use with time; as of this writing, I've had the belt for just under a week.

reviews.reviewText: Great fit and finish. I really like the buckle's looks and functionality. This is my first experience with this type of belt and am so pleased I'll likely buy another in a different color!
